txt.en: Latharn has been defeated.\n\nYou should check on Aighrig.
Talk to Aighrig
Defend Lúkhag
drama_aighrig_call_out
Defend Aighrig
Lúkhag has led you to Dûn Traikh, presumably where she last saw Aighrig.
Approach Lúkhag

'Have you seen that island in the middle of the lake, [placeholder]? Grytholm, it is called, home to the bats of this region. I once considered it peaceful, but the Angmarim have taken over the cave on the island since, twisting bats to do their bidding. Gáfin must have discovered this before he died.\n\n'I came here in search of Latharn, the one who wrote the report we found in Zarkul-sulûn. Join me if you wish, but I will continue with or without you.'
'My daughter has chosen her side. Kill her, and her friend as well.'
'[placeholder]! To me!'
'This [placeholder] and their pet have death wishes!'
'Lúkhag, you little pest, why did you lead [placeholder] here?'
'Then let us grant them!'
'No matter... it is too late now.'
'Do you remember your old home, Lúkhag? I am sorry it has become a den of evil.'
'Send this note to Rékkur. He will want to know what we have found. Now fly!'
'[placeholder], I expect you have questions.'
Lúkhag is waiting for you on the road leading to Dûn Traikh.
Seeing that you've caught up, Lúkhag continues flying towards Dûn Traikh.
'Back to Annâk-khurfu, then. I have had enough of this place.'
'You were... ever the rebel. I am only sorry that I did not kill you sooner.'
'Hundreds of deaths I envisioned for myself... and none at the hands of my own daughter.'
Talk to Aighrig
'You will be the death of our people.'
'I will not. Good-bye, father.'
Observe the confrontation
'It is done.'
Defend Aighrig
Talk to Aighrig
Lúkhag has led you to Aighrig, who has come to Dûn Traikh alone.
<rgb=#FF0000>Aighrig has been defeated!</rgb>
Lúkhag appears to know where she's going, but will need you to defend her.
<rgb=#FF0000>Lúkhag has been defeated!</rgb>
Aighrig is determined to find Latharn.
Aighrig has stopped in front of the tower and has something to say.
'Come out, Latharn! I know you are not alone.'
'My daughter, as perceptive as ever.'
'Stay your hand. Please, do not attack them unless they attack first. I hope it does not come to that, but....'
'Why do you continue to help the Angmarim? The war is over. We have lost.'
'The war is not over simply because some king deemed it so.'
Aighrig seems intent on confronting the Angmarim at the tower's entrance.\n\nShe has asked you not to attack them unless it's in self-defence.
'There are more Angmarim ahead. Be ready!'
'But you are not here to debate such petty matters. Why did you come?'
'You! You should have left and kept running!'
'To save you. You are fighting a losing battle.'
'Ha! Saves us the trouble of hunting you down!'
'No. I am ensuring that our people will prevail.'
'How kind of you to present yourself to us. Latharn will be pleased!'
'Can you not see that the Angmarim are driving us to ruin?'
The conversation between Latharn and Aighrig has not ended peacefully.
'I will make sure he is sorely disappointed.'
'You have changed, Aighrig.'
Instance: Mysteries To Unravel
'We will brook no traitors here!'

'The Angmarim had my father in their clutches from the start.... I should have known that he would believe them to the bitter end. May the earth reclaim his bones and find some use for him.

'I will not apologize for coming here on my own, as it was my burden to bear. Still, I appreciate your help; I did not think you would trust me after learning of my past.

'Let me know when you are ready to depart. Rékkur ought to know the truth behind Gáfin's death.'
'Then I am glad to be a traitor.'
'Hold for a moment, [placeholder].'
